title: Bitcoin Trap Is Almost Fully Set! [Positioning Matters NOW]

chunks.text: [music] The Bitcoin trap is almost set. And in today's video, we'll talk about why price is dumping, who the most likely candidates, whether that be the bulls or the bears, are going to be the ones that are trapped in the following days and weeks to come. What you should do next to avoid this and not only avoid it, but actually profit off of it. So stay tuned till the end of the show. Smash the like button. Let's get straight into the show content. We are seeing a sea of red and it's got a lot to do with of course Trump which we'll talk about in a moment. So why exactly is price dumping? Well, one of the things started to take place I guess from a technical perspective which I spoke about in whroom discord on the update yesterday basically saying that uh I am going to be looking for prices to come down probably in the short term as well. Remember we had that short-term upside bias and I said that part of the reason why is you are starting to see a lot of the crypto charts uh coming within terms of the altcoin sector being a leading indicator taking out the Tuesday the 13th uh candle 13th of of January candle that was the candle that brought a little bit of optimism I call them the we're so back bull cheerleaders those guys started to come back into play and that was based on that candle and you didn't want to take out that candle was this one over here and I said I'm expecting most of these coins to come back down towards new lows. We do have a couple of trade setups as well. We'll cover one of those today based off of this whereby you can probably profit off of the downside move. So, a lot of it of course fundamentally has to do with Trump coming out. You can see over here he says Denmark has been unable to do anything about it about that being Greenland and Russia. And he says now it is time and it will be done. So, you're seeing those tensions arise. You're seeing Trump coming out and announcing 10% tariffs on eight different EU countries demanding an acquisition of Greenland. So this narrative is building up steam over here and consequently what we saw is the S&P 500 futures chart come down negative um 0.7% NASDAQ down 1% Dow Jones.5% and then actually gold and silver immediately shot back up continuing its bull run over there 1% and 3% respectively. So, we have officially hit takerit zone one over here on gold. It's officially come into that. That was when we set this trade up all the way back here on the 25th of November, right? We've seen that continuation now higher. And I'm expecting gold to still go even higher from here. Silver extending its gains. We spoke about how you could get into a position last week where you didn't want to take out that low. That was the candle to flush people out on the 15th of January on Thursday. As long as you were long with a stop loss below there, you could hold that position pretty much. Leave your stop in the same place. No need to change that. Looking at continuation higher. And then we have the platinum trade which is still getting ready to take off. Um you shouldn't have been stopped out. I wouldn't change anything. Leave the stop loss in exactly the same place there. Uh and what is going on on copper? Not too much. Lot of liquidity building up over here on copper. So if you are long on copper, of course, do be careful on that. And then I just want to touch on two charts over here. One is Tesla. I do think Tesla is going to come back a little bit deeper towards this trend line. Will it hold? I guess it's going to come down to the rise in tensions, geopolitical tensions, the tariff warfare. It's probably going to affect this as well. You may see a bit of a deeper sweep, but we have to have an invalidation somewhere because if you take out this low, you're probably coming for these lows. And then we just need to re-evaluate on that trade. We have a head short that's on the table as well. Um, and that that is Apple. Apple was too weak to even get back into the triangle. We spoke about the potential that maybe it could come up here. If it did, this would be the most likely place for rejection. Didn't even get that far.

Um, we can move on into what you can expect as well leading on to the rest of the year as per fractals go. Well, usually what we see is into this midterm period. And I want to reiterate this is taking a lot of data and aggregating each year, one over the top of each other all the way from 1928 to the current levels. What we tend to see is the first year in office does lead to upside. Midterms lead to a little bit of downside consolidation and then pre-election year you start to reaccumulate. Uh price moves up aggressively and in the election year again continuation. So, in terms of that midterm year, there is a possibility if we do start to see a lot of these magnificent sevens rolling over, which we now have very few that are in uptrend, right? A lot of them are starting to turn over and the S&P 500 turns over as well. Well, that could bring that downside. That brings in the Bitcoin low for the end of the bare market which as per timing cycles which we followed all the way from the beginning to the end of the bull run was remember 1,85ish days was give or take the time period that we're looking at. Well, now you're looking you're following a similar trajectory. Usually it's between 365 and about 400 days give or take. So you're giving it about one year from top to bottom to October to October. And so far we are still following that, right? We're following that trajectory. We are following peak five which is taking it from peak back down to trough. This is the purple line. Everything is still in order over here in relationship to cycle four, three, and two. We've left out cycle one because it was too young. Uh so we'll skip that one. So what does that mean? What what that typically means is that you can start to target the long-term holder realized price for a major bottom which is actually lining up over here at $38,000. Now, there will of course be bounces along the way, and the question you have to ask yourself is, are the short-term holders going to get back into profit? For them to get back into profit, you need to see price breaking above 98,365. It did happen a couple of times within the bull run where we lost it, reclaimed, lost it, reclaimed, lost it, reclaimed. But the question is, are we in this environment where the arrows are pointing up to lose it and reclaim? Are we in this environment above my head over here where you rally into that short-term holder cost basis and then turn back over once again? Well, at least you guys know where my mindsets at. I think that there's a higher probability uh based on many other factors that we probably in this environment and then you can see you tend to move back towards realized price. Realized price is what we call fair value for Bitcoin. This is um you know based on onchain metrics how the miners are doing and that is in that $56,000 region which almost always elicits at least a technical bounce and then you revisit back into that long-term holder realized price which over time is moving up. So it could be between 38 and $45,000 probably by the time that level does get hit. That's going to be one of the longer term targets over there. Another thing that we're looking at is the uh price entering into quicksand on the Gausian channel.

Now remember, by the time the Gausian channel turns red, uh the worst is pretty much over and you're basically at your bare market lows. But what we typically see is once you break back into that Gausian channel on the weekly scale, you tend to see price lose the midband, bounce back up above the midband, and then follow through and lose the lower band. by the time it loses the low band, everybody knows that it's a bare market and it's all in full agreement and then it's just a waiting game for a couple of months later to set in the major low and then reaccumulate. So to avoid this quicksand disaster for Bitcoin on the weekly scale, you would actually need price to rally all the way back up and reclaim that $110,000 level. So, for anyone that's a long-term trader, investor, swing trader, whatever it is you want to call it, and you're holding positions for months to even years, this is probably pretty important for you to consider that price is weak until you can get back above that 110K level. And that simultaneously would get you back above the short-term holder realized price, which means that the short-term holders, the speculators, um, who came in late, of course, under a lot of pressure and strain over here. and that can lead to lower prices if they decide that they want to cut those losses. So, we spoke about this. We spoke about the similarities. Now, could you spike up a little bit higher one more time? It's possible. But we looked at the timing factor over here as well. And if you zoom in from the low to that peak, well, that took nine weeks, right? Nine weeks and then things started to fade. This is nine weeks from the low to current price. nine weeks exactly like before and price is starting to roll over. So that's what you have to ask yourself from a timing perspective. You know, maybe you have one more week of upside, but based on last week's candle, um you guys know the saying, it's not looking good, bro. It's not looking good, right?
